title: South Live: Friday 27 October - BBC News
summary: woman jailed for torching homeless man 's bedding .
councillor told to say sorry over scuffle .
driver in court over pony trap crash death .

text: reading 0-2 middlesbrough

documents.title: good evening
text: that 's all for today from bbc south live - thanks for joining us !
we 'll be back again at 08:00 on monday with all of the latest news , travel , sport and weather for the region .
stay in touch on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: dfe to 'work closely ' with council on future of sandown bay academy
text: the department for education has released a statement about today 's decision to make sandown bay academy a council-run school .
it says the options were `` carefully considered '' and that it has approved , in-principle , its closure at the end of the academic year .
`` our priority is to ensure all children receive the best possible education and where that is not happening action must be taken , '' a spokesperson added .
`` we will work closely with the local authority to ensure sandown bay academy pupils will have a school place for the 2018/19 academic year . ''

documents.title: parachute wife 'should n't have survived '
text: the wife of an army sergeant accused of tampering with her parachute said she should have never survived a 4,000ft fall , a court has been told .
victoria cilliers , 42 , suffered multiple injuries in a fall in wiltshire in april 2015 .
emile cilliers , 37 , an army sergeant based in aldershot , denies two counts of attempted murder and one of recklessly endangering life .
mrs cilliers told the court she could not categorically say if it was or was not an accident .
but she added : `` never in the history of parachuting worldwide has it happened . ''
the trial at winchester crown court continues .

documents.title: flying boat services plaque unveiled in poole
text: a blue plaque to mark poole museum 's role in the history of flying boat services has been unveiled today .
british overseas airways corporation , royal australian air force , the raf and the fleet air arm 's seaplane training division all flew out of poole harbour during the 1930s and 40s .
the mayor of poole , lindsay wilson , unveiled the plaque .
it features an image of an empire class flying boat .

documents.title: blue plaque for harbour 's flying boats
text: blue plaque for harbour 's flying boats

documents.title: langdale hall in witney returned to community
text: a community hall in witney has been taken off the market and will be turned into a community hub .
langdale hall was previously being sold to fund the corn exchange refurbishment but the council has found funding elsewhere .
the inclusive care and education centre is one of several charities and local groups that hope to move into the hub early next year .
author: Phil Mercer
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: carrier 's delayed departure set for monday
text: the royal navy 's new £ 3bn aircraft carrier will depart for sea trials on monday , portsmouth 's harbour authority has said .
earlier this week , hms queen elizabeth 's operator said the ship was unable to leave port because of bad weather and ongoing engineering work .
the aircraft carrier alliance ( aca ) said : `` we plan to sail later this week when we can ensure a safe exit . ''
the queen 's harbourmaster at portsmouth said the 12:45 departure on monday was `` confirmed '' and not `` provisional '' .

documents.title: black holes and revelations
text: stephen hawking is the first speaker at oxford university 's mathematical institute for the inaugural roger penrose lecture .
the lecture is sold out but you can watch the famous theoretical physicist and cosmologist live on the university of oxford facebook channel .

documents.title: eastleigh 's hill backed by chairman
text: eastleigh 's hill backed by chairman

documents.title: date set to open £ 10m port expansion
text: a £ 10m quay to accommodate large cruise and cargo ships will be opened on 23 january , the port 's operator has said .
work began in january to construct the 200m ( 650ft ) long south quay at poole in dorset .
the hamworthy site will enable the port to handle longer and heavier vessels , poole harbour commissioners ( phc ) said .
the operator said it could generate an extra £ 10m a year for the local economy .

documents.title: group sought in 'split jaw ' attack
text: cctv images have been released of men who may have information about an attack that left a man with a split jaw .
the incident took place outside a parade of shops next to the silver birch public house in bracknell on 22 september at about 23:30 .
the 40-year-old male victim was punched in the head by a group of people , causing serious injuries to his jaw .
he was taken to hospital and now has a metal plate holding his jaw together .

det con michele green from thames valley police said : `` i am keen to speak to the men in these cctv images , as they could have information which is vital to our investigation into this incident . ''

documents.title: all-through school in sandown bay announced
text: sandown bay academy on the isle of wight is to be merged with a local primary school to create an all-through school run by the local council .
the department for education ( dfe ) has given conditional in-principle approval for the closure of the academy , which at the moment is run by the academies enterprise trust .
the academy was rated `` inadequate '' by ofsted earlier this year because of `` ineffective leadership at all levels '' .
paul brading , cabinet member for children 's services , called it `` fantastic news '' that would `` make sandown a centre of educational excellence '' .
bob seely mp said : `` this is a victory for everyone involved but particularly for parents in the bay area who made it clear this is what they wanted . ''

a spokesperson for the trust said : `` we are committed to supporting the dfe and council plans by ensuring the best possible provision at sandown bay for the rest of this academic year and working together to secure an orderly transition before we step aside in august 2018 . ''

documents.title: academy to become council-run school
text: academy to become council-run school

documents.title: no action to be taken against councillor who branded homeless a 'disgrace '
text: an oxford councillor who said he would like to tell some rough sleepers they are a disgrace and that they `` ought to have more respect '' wo n't face any further action .
john tanner , who made the comments on bbc radio oxford , has admitted that they were `` very unwise '' .
`` i was quite wrong to imply that it was in any way the fault of the beggars , '' he added .
he has since apologised formally to the council and councillors , and issued a press release .

the oxford city council report said he had `` voluntarily and speedily undertaken the actions the panel would have been likely to have required of him '' , and had taken `` reasonable and effective steps to make amends for the lapse in judgement '' .

documents.title: woman jailed for torching homeless man 's bedding
text: a woman who urinated on a homeless man 's belongings before her friend set them on fire has been jailed .
nicola king , 23 , handed a lighter to 25-year-old jerely evans so she could burn bedding in the doorway of a closed shop in portsmouth .
king , of no fixed address , pleaded guilty to arson at an earlier hearing .
jailing her for four months at portsmouth magistrates ' court , judge anthony callaway said it was `` a cruel act on a vulnerable and isolated man '' .

documents.title: dispersal order placed on basingstoke town centre
text: after two police officers were assaulted in basingstoke on wednesday night , a dispersal order 's been placed on the town centre from now until saturday morning .
it means police can tell groups of people to leave the area if they 're being intimidating .
two boys , aged 13 and 14 , were arrested in connection with the assault on wednesday .
they 've been released while investigations continue .
author: Chris Browning
BBC Radio Berkshire

documents.title: 'dirty changing rooms ' at pool claim
text: 'dirty changing rooms ' at pool claim

documents.title: falklands invasion veterans in bid for recognition
text: a former soldier who faced thousands of argentine troops as they invaded the falklands is backing a campaign for he and his comrades to be recognised for their service .
nick williams , from bournemouth , was one of 69 royal marines who feared `` certain death '' the day the islands were invaded on 2 april 1982 .
but he later faced ridicule because his unit was effectively ordered to surrender when a ceasefire was called to protect the islanders .
an online petition , launched by military historian ricky phillips , is calling for a bar to add to their medals .
it has so far gained more than 3,700 signatures .

documents.title: last chance to have say on southampton road plans
text: people in southampton are being encouraged take part in a public consultation on improvements to the eastern approach route to the city .
the six-week public consultation on plans for a major upgrade to junction 8 of the m27 and the a3024 to southampton city centre ends on 31 october ,

the plans will increase capacity at junction 8 of the m27 and windhover roundabout , as well as upgrade 25 junctions along the a3024 - which includes bursledon road , maybray king way , bitterne road west , northam bridge and northam road .
highways england claims improved safety , upgrades to two railway bridges and better facilities for pedestrians and cyclists are also part of the proposals .
details on the proposals and feedback forms will be available online until 23:45 gmt on 31 october on the highways england website .

documents.title: paranormal investigators in dorset investigate ghostly claims
text: meet the paranormal investigators called in to investigate spooky goings-on across the south of england .
the volunteers from the paranormal research team in dorset spend their time compiling evidence of paranormal phenomena .

documents.title: 'large fire ' at lytchett matravers industrial estate
text: dorset firefighters were kept very busy last night with a large fire involving an industrial unit in the lytchett matravers area .
local residents were advised to shut windows and doors due to hazardous smoke .
we 'll bring you more details when they are released .

documents.title: did the m25 cat killer strike on the isle of wight ?
text: for the past two years , a serial killer has been attacking pet cats in britain , leaving behind him a trail of fear and mistrust .
there have been reports of him operating in britain since 2015 .
during that time he - and police are sure the killer is a man - has butchered more than 370 animals , mostly pet cats , but also foxes , rabbits and possibly a wild , baby owl .
the first reported victims were clustered around croydon in south london - so the press named him the croydon cat killer .
but killings were later reported all around london , prompting a second nickname , the m25 cat killer .
in fact , his hunting ground has spread even further than this - to the isle of wight , kent , birmingham , wirral and sheffield .

documents.title: this morning 's weather from south today
text: this morning 's weather from south today

documents.title: fly-tipping : is it worse where hampshire councils charge ?
text: the bbc has taken an in-depth look at the problem of fly-tipping and asked if it is linked to the amount councils charge for taking rubbish to the tip ?
the local government association , which represents councils , said there was `` no evidence '' to link fly-tipping to any particular trend .

however , six of the 10 areas to have seen the biggest rises in fly-tipping in the last year do charge householders to take some types of rubbish to the tip , mainly building rubble , plaster and hardcore .
tips in fareham and basingstoke and deane , which come under hampshire county council , charge for plasterboard , soil and rubble .
the areas saw the second and eighth highest rises respectively .

documents.title: police release 30 photos after pompey disorder
text: aggressive disorder that spilled out of fratton park into the streets of portsmouth has sparked an urgent police appeal to find these 30 men .
author: The News, Portsmouth

documents.title: bursledon pony and trap fatal crash : driver in court
text: a driver has appeared in court charged with causing a crash that killed a man riding in a pony and trap .
william gaskin , 33 , from worplesdon , near guildford , died in hospital after the crash in bursledon , hampshire , at about 23:30 bst on 26 march .
oliver wareham , 29 , from southampton , appeared before the city 's magistrates charged with causing death by careless driving while over the alcohol limit .
mr wareham , of rownhams road , is due at southampton crown court on 24 november .

documents.title: oxbridge inequality : admissions data not 'whole story '
text: data for the number of black students admitted to oxford colleges `` does not tell the whole story '' , the university 's african and caribbean society has said .
it comes after figures obtained by david lammy mp found populations at oxford and cambridge were heavily made up of white , well-off students .
their release has sparked public debate about access to the universities .
but oxford 's african and caribbean society has warned reducing the issue to `` political soundbites '' can do harm .
in a statement issued by the student-run group on twitter , the society said the data had revealed `` significant issues of institutionalised cultural and economic bias at oxford '' .
the oxford acs official press release in response to recent controversy by mps over lack of diversity at oxford university :
it is unfortunate that our critical engagement with the systemic issues affecting our community is seen as a piecemeal project .
# acsoutreach
good @ twitterid challenges oxford but we continue to collaborate to make a bigger impact
thank you for all your support , samina .
we truly appreciate it and we are looking forward to continuing to tackle this issue together !
focusing on oxbridge creates a useful scapegoat , the real problem needing addressing is the systemic barriers that obstruct black students
surely by using affimative action you just create a new problem of those students then being seen as `` token '' students by everyone else ?
i mean no-one said anything about affirmative action they just said we can not ignore the structural implications at work in all of this
making young black people more equipped/ prepared to enter such an environment actually takes away the token element
why do these black kids deserve to be more equipped than other kids in the class ?
lets fight institutional racism with more discrimination ?
really worth reading this from the oxford african and caribbean students .
interested in spking to you .
we 've had the conversation with ucl , kings & cambridge & ran collaborative events .
wd be good to discuss further
tell more more about this conspiracy which stops black students doing well .
admission by lottery .
please tell me how can i get a scholership from oxford
`` the under-representation of black students is something oxford has struggled with `` struggled with .
lol .

documents.title: councillor told to apologise for eu referendum tussle
text: a labour councillor has been told to apologise after a tussle with security staff at an eu referendum count .
mike rowley , oxford city council 's cabinet member for housing , was ejected by police after being restrained when he tried to enter the venue .
mr rowley grappled with door staff for several minutes and shouted : `` i am an elected member of this chamber . ''
the council 's standards assessment panel has told him to say sorry to the town hall and security staff .
a crowd of about 15 people watched the altercation at oxford town hall at about 00:30 bst on 24 june 2016 .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to south live , where we 'll bring you the latest updates from across the region until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
